summary:
I am a researcher in the Greenhouse Technology group at Wageningen Research, exploring how to optimize the optical and material properties of greenhouse covering and screen materials to move towards more sustainable, energy-efficient greenhouses.  

I got my PhD in Physics at the Radboud University Nijmegen in 2022. In my thesis I investigated the possibility of using ultrashort laser pulses (shorter than 1 billionth of a second!) to write and store bits of digital information in magnetic media in a faster and energy efficient way, and to reduce the bit-size to the nanometre scale using plasmonic nanostructures.

I have more than 6 years of experience in experimental condensed matter physics, exploring physical (electric, magnetic, optical and magneto-optical) properties of materials with various technological applications.

My academic training has helped me develop various skills such as experimental, technical and programming skills, data analysis, project management, academic writing and presentation as well as collaboration. 

I am looking forward to apply my knowledge and skills in a professional setting to pursue some of my interests including: sustainability and energy research, education, science communication,  illustration and writing.

Dilute Stuffing in the pyrochlore iridate Eu2Ir2O7 (2nd author)

Ultrafast demagnetization in a ferrimagnet under electromagnetic field funneling

profile_positions.description: As part of the Greenhouse Technology unit at Wageningen Research, I will be working on tuning the optical and material properties of greenhouse covering and screen materials to move towards more sustainable and energy-saving greenhouses.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
As part of my PhD projects, I am investigating:
i) the mechanism and possibility of 'switching' the magnetization of certain materials all-optically (using ultrashort laser pulses, in the absence of any external magnetic field) to write and erase magnetic information ultrafast, with high bit-density and high energy-efficiency 
ii) Combining such materials with plasmonic nano-antennas to further improve the energy efficiency and drastically reduce the bit density
I did many of these projects as part of a large international network of collaborators under the EU-FET project 'FEMTOTERABYTE'. 

Some of the skills I developed in the course of my PhD include:
- Ultrafast Laser Optics: building and operating pump-probe setups with time resolution of hundreds of femtoseconds
- Building magneto-optical domain contrast imaging with micrometer-scale spatial resolution; 
- Exerience with cryogenic instrumentation;
- Data and image analysis using software like MATLAB, Origin and ImageJ; scripting measurement programs using LabVIEW 
- Teaching and supervision
- Team work and collaboration
- Presentation, writing and illustration Skills
profile_positions.title: PHD Student

profile_positions.description:
Assisted on the 'Thermodynamics' course to design student tutorial questions connecting thermodynamics concepts to more 'real-world' examples and scenarios to build a broader understanding of the applications of Thermodynamics. 

Tutored for the Physics courses 'Nanophysics' and 'Advanced Spectroscopy' : involved in preparing assignment questions, guiding students to solve exercise problems and grading assignments and exam sheets.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant
